channel.title: Asynchronous Workflows on Mark Needham
channel.description: Recent content in Asynchronous Workflows on Mark Needham

item.title: F#: Playing around with asynchronous workflows
item.description: I spent a bit of time over the weekend playing around with F# asynchronous workflows and seeing how they could be used to launch Firefox windows asynchronously for my FeedBurner graph creator. Initially I decided to try out the ‘Async.RunWithContinuations’ function which I recently read about on Matthew Podwysocki’s blog. Matthew describes this as being a function which is useful for executing a single operation asynchronously and this worked out quite well for me as my application only has the ability to get one feed and then create a graph from its data.
